result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DeJon Ramone Wilson Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DeJon Ramone Wilson Sr appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Steinle appeared by video for DeJon Ramone Wilson Sr.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel informs court that the defendant does not wish to take advantage of the deferred prosecution agreement. Further, defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants request. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 10.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant DeJon Ramone Wilson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-16-22 at 8:30 am for a DPA hearing.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant DeJon Ramone Wilson in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense awaiting an offer from the State.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant DeJon Ramone Wilson in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
$2,500.00Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DRW Jr.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant DeJon Ramone Wilson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 050618,
Payable Number: 1009679,
Receipt Number: 22RP021764,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@2p
